method: Rinse and place in plastic recycling bin
tip: Recycled into new bottles, containers, or textile fibers.
why: Plastic bottles are melted and remolded into new plastic products, reducing plastic waste.

method: Place in compost bin or organic waste
tip: Cut into smaller pieces to speed up decomposition.
why: Composting banana peels enriches soil with nutrients and reduces landfill waste.

method: Rinse, flatten, and place in carton recycling
tip: Milk cartons are made from paperboard with a plastic lining and can be recycled into paper products.
why: Recycling milk cartons saves trees and reduces landfill.

method: Rinse and place in glass recycling bin
tip: Remove caps and lids; recycle metal separately.
why: Glass is endlessly recyclable and can be remade into new bottles or jars.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Most curbside programs do not accept Styrofoam.
why: Styrofoam breaks down very slowly and contaminates recycling streams.

method: Crush and add to compost pile
tip: Eggshells add calcium and minerals to compost.
why: Provides essential nutrients for plants when composted.

method: Dispose of in general waste bin
tip: Greasy or food-soiled cardboard contaminates recycling streams.
why: Contaminated cardboard cannot be recycled and must be landfilled or composted if accepted.

method: Rinse and place in metal recycling bin
tip: Recycling aluminum saves up to 95% of the energy compared to making new aluminum.
why: Aluminum is melted down and reused indefinitely without quality loss.

method: Place in general waste bin
tip: Due to contamination, tissues are not recyclable or compostable.
why: Prevent spread of germs and contamination in recycling facilities.

method: Place in paper recycling bin
tip: Avoid recycling wet or food-stained newspaper.
why: Recycled paper is made into new paper products, reducing tree harvesting.

method: Remove staples if any, and place in compost bin
tip: Ensure tea bags are plastic-free for composting.
why: Tea bags break down and enrich compost with organic matter.

method: Take to special plastic bag recycling drop-off points
tip: Do not place in curbside recycling; bags clog machines.
why: Plastic bags can be recycled into plastic lumber or new bags if properly processed.

method: Take to battery recycling facility or collection point
tip: Store safely and avoid landfill due to toxic chemicals.
why: Recycling prevents toxic metals from polluting environment.

why: Cardboard tubes are recyclable and reused in paper products.

method: Add to compost bin or use as mulch in garden
tip: Mix with dry leaves for balanced compost.
why: Adds nitrogen and organic matter to soil.

method: Add to compost bin
tip: Crush before composting to speed up decomposition.
why: Adds carbon-rich material to compost.

method: Take to e-waste recycling facility
tip: Never place in curbside bins due to toxic components.
why: Contains metals and chemicals that can be recovered and reused.

method: Compost if natural cork; recycle through cork recycling programs
tip: Avoid composting synthetic corks.
why: Natural cork is biodegradable and enriches compost.

method: Add to compost bin or use as garden mulch
tip: Shred leaves for faster breakdown.
why: Adds carbon and improves soil health.

method: Flatten and place in paper recycling bin
tip: Remove plastic liner before recycling.
why: Cardboard is recycled into new paper products.

method: Add to compost but expect slow breakdown
tip: Chop or grind for faster composting.
why: Organic waste enriches compost and soil quality.

method: Return to pharmacy take-back programs
tip: Do not flush or throw in trash.
why: Prevents water contamination and misuse.

method: Flatten and place in cardboard recycling
tip: Remove non-paper tape and packaging.
why: Recycled cardboard is used for new boxes and paper products.

method: Add to compost bin or garden
tip: Coffee grounds add nitrogen and improve soil quality.
why: Organic waste reduces landfill methane emissions.

method: Dispose in general waste bin
tip: Plastic straws are not recyclable and pollute oceans.
why: Avoid single-use plastics where possible.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Most paper cups have plastic lining, making them non-recyclable.
why: They contaminate paper recycling streams.

method: Take to scrap metal recycling facility
tip: Donate if reusable or recycle as metal scrap.
why: Metals can be melted and reused indefinitely.

method: Add to compost bin
tip: Chop into smaller pieces to speed composting.
why: Organic peel waste enriches soil and reduces landfill.

method: Rinse and recycle according to plastic type
tip: Check local recycling guidelines for plastic codes.
why: Recycling plastic reduces demand for new plastic production.

method: Return to manufacturer or store take-back program
tip: Avoid landfill disposal due to toxic ink residues.
why: Cartridges can be refilled or recycled properly to reduce waste.

method: Add to compost bin or feed to animals if safe
tip: Avoid moldy bread in compost to prevent pests.
why: Composting bread reduces landfill organic waste.

method: Clean and recycle with metal scrap
tip: Ball up foil to avoid loss in recycling machines.
why: Aluminum foil can be recycled multiple times.

method: Collect in a sealed container and take to hazardous waste facility
tip: Do not pour down drains or into soil.
why: Oil contaminates water and harms aquatic life.

method: Dispose in general waste bin
tip: Never throw on the ground; toxic chemicals harm the environment.
why: Butts contain plastic filters and toxins that do not biodegrade.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Not recyclable through most municipal programs.
why: Thin plastic films clog recycling machinery.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Do not flush down toilets.
why: Gum is not biodegradable and contaminates waterways.

method: Compost if untreated wood
tip: Avoid treated or painted wood items.
why: Natural wood decomposes and adds organic matter to soil.

method: Take to hazardous waste collection points
tip: Contains small amounts of mercury; handle carefully.
why: Proper disposal prevents mercury contamination.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Avoid flushing; they cause plumbing blockages.
why: Non-biodegradable plastic stems pollute the environment.

method: Recycle according to plastic type
tip: Check local recycling policies for plastic toys.
why: Extending toy life reduces plastic waste.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Wax coating prevents recycling or composting.
why: Cannot be processed by recycling facilities.

method: Rinse and place in metal recycling bin
tip: Remove labels if possible.
why: Steel cans can be recycled endlessly with energy savings.

method: Dispose in general waste
tip: Do not flush or compost.
why: Non-biodegradable and contains human waste.
